715226f-a.title: Manhattan: 120th Street (West) - Amsterdam Avenue
715226f-a.text:
west 120th Street, north side, between Amsterdam Ave. and
Broadway, showing the tower atop Russell Hall as viewed northward
from University Hall. This structure, a unit of Teachers College
(one of the affiliates of Columbia University) was erected at a cost
of over'2,000,000 in 1923 as a memorial to James Earl Russell, the
dean here for 25 years. Inside of the tower are book stacks of the
Library; the reading rooms occupying the upper floors. The lower
stories house the administrative offices.
1936.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
